CFL.documentation: CFL number. Determines the size of the (initial) time step. The CFL number is defined as stencil_scaling/(dx*(p+1)^2).

Stencil.documentation: The discrete velocity stencil. The number behind D denotes the dimension (2 or 3). The number behind Q denotes the number of particle directions in the discrete velocity model.

Stencil_20scaling.documentation: The scaling of the discrete velocities. Whereas in the standard LBM the magnitude of the particle velocities is set to 1.0 due to the uniform mesh grid, the SEDG-LBM features scaled particle velocities. As the scaling factor is proportional to the speed of sound, it strongly impacts the relaxation time.

Has_20analytic_20solution_3f.documentation: Indicates whether the given flow problem is inherited of BenchmarkProblem, which means that it has an analytic solution with which the numerical solution can be compared.

Advection_20scheme.documentation: The algorithm which is used for the advection (=streaming) step. While the LBM on a uniform mesh facilitates streaming towards a simple index shift, non-uniform meshes need a more sophisticated advection scheme.

Time_20integrator.documentation: The algorithm which is used for the time integration of the discretizted advection (=streaming) equation. A time integrator is required, when the advection scheme is based upon some Finite Element/Difference/Volume or discontinuous Galerkin scheme. Other refers to deal.II's built-in integrators which are accessible through the section DealIntegrator.

Order_20of_20finite_20element.documentation: The degree of the polynomial shape functions used by the SEDG scheme.

Flux_20type.documentation: The flux connects the shape functions between neighboring elements. It is strongly recommended to use the Lax-Friedrichs scheme which is a forward-discretization along characteristics, rather than a central flux.

Theta.documentation: Theta=0: Explicit Euler; Theta=0.5: Crank-Nicolson; Theta=1.0: Implicit Euler.

Runge_20Kutta_20scheme.documentation: Deal.ii built-in time integrators. They are accessed by chosing time integrator = other.
Runge_20Kutta_20scheme.pattern_description: [Selection Forward Euler|RK 3rd order|RK Classic 4th order|Backward Euler|Implicit midpoint|Crank-Nicoloson|SDIRK 2 stages|Heun-Euler|Bogacki-Shampine|Dopri|Fehlberg|Cash-Karp|None ]

Coarsen_20parameter.documentation: Parameter for the embedded deal.II methods. This parameter is the factor (>1) by which the time step is multiplied when the time stepping can be coarsen.

Refinement_20parameter.documentation: Parameter for the embedded deal.II methods. This parameter is the factor (<1) by which the time step is multiplied when the time stepping must be refined.

Minimum_20CFL.documentation: Parameter for the embedded deal.II methods. Smallest CFL allowed.

Maximum_20CFL.documentation: Parameter for the embedded deal.II methods. Largest CFL allowed.

Refinement_20tolerance.documentation: Parameter for the embedded deal.II methods. Refinement tolerance: if the error estimate is larger than refine_tol, the time step is refined.

Coarsen_20tolerance.documentation: Parameter for the embedded deal.II methods. Coarsening tolerance: if the error estimate is smaller than coarse_tol, the time step is coarsen.

Collision_20scheme.documentation: The collision step models velocity changes due to particle collisions (local at each node) by a relaxation towards thermodynamic equilibrium. There are several approaches, e.g. the single-relaxation time Bhatnagar-Gro√ü-Krook (BGK) model. The standard
Collision_20scheme.pattern_description: [Selection BGK standard|BGK steady state|BGK standard transformed|BGK multiphase|BGK incompressible|MRT standard|KBC standard ]

Steady_20state_20gamma.documentation: The parameter of the steady state preconditioner. For gamma = 1, the scheme is equivalent to the standard BGKFor gamma -> 0, the convergence to steady states is speed up and the effective Mach number is lowered, whichgives nearly incompressible results.

Pseudopotential_20type.documentation: The functional form of the pseudopotential in multiphase simulations.

Pseudopotential_20G.documentation: The parameter that describes the interaction strength in the Pseudopotential multiphase model.

Pseudopotential_20T.documentation: The parameter that describes the temperature in the Pseudopotential multiphase model (only for Carnahan-Starling EOS).

Forcing_20scheme.documentation: The way to incorporate the force into the LBGK equation.

Filtering_20scheme.documentation: A filter that dampens the high-frequent oscillations from the distribution functions.

Exponential_20alpha.documentation: The exponential filter is defined exp(-alpha * poly_degree ^ s

Exponential_20s.documentation: The exponential filter is defined exp(-alpha * poly_degree ^ s

Restart_20at_20iteration.documentation: The solver can be restarted at a stored checkpoint, in case that an old run had been aborted at some point of time.The iteration at which the solver is to be restarted. You have to make sure that a checkpoint file corresponding to that iteration exists.

Initialization_20scheme.documentation: The initial particle distribution functions are normally assumed to be in local equilibrium. A more stable (and costly) scheme is to do some streaming steps on the density field but not on the velocity field, before starting the actual simulations (see e.g. the Book of Guo and Shu).

Residual.documentation: The iterative initialization stops, when the density increment is smaller than the residual, i.e. the iteration has converged.

Number_20of_20iterations.documentation: The iterative initialization stops at the latest after a specific number of iterations.

Number_20of_20time_20steps.documentation: The maximum number of time steps.

Simulation_20end_20time.documentation: The end time of the simulation. Especially for adaptive time stepping schemes, number of steps is not an appropriate stop condition

Convergence_20threshold.documentation: The codes stops when the maximum velocity variation is below this threshold in 10 iterations.

User_20interaction_3f.documentation: Indicates, whether to ask the user in case that configurations are unclear or old files are possibly overwritten.

Output_20directory.documentation: The name of the directory to which the output is written.

Output_20checkpoint_20interval.documentation: Write out checkpoint files every ... step.

Output_20table_20interval.documentation: Write out a line to the result table every ... step.

Command_20line_20verbosity.documentation: The amount of command line output.

Write_20a_20log_20file_3f.documentation: Specifies if log is written to a file.

Output_20turbulence_20statistics_3f.documentation: Specifies if turbulence statistics should be monitored.

Wall_20normal_20direction.documentation: Convergence is monitored by putting out the turbulence statistics over planes that are parallel to the wall. The wall normal direction can be 0,1,2 for x,y,z, respectively.

Wall_20normal_20coordinates.documentation: Convergence is monitored by putting out the turbulence statistics over planes that are parallel to the wall. This comma-separated list of decimal numbers specifies their wall-normal coordinates.
